thread.section_title: M is for Music – Discover Music News
thread.title: Grateful Dead Announce Cornell 1977 Box Set
thread.title_full: Grateful Dead Announce Cornell 1977 Box Set

author: Pitchfork
title: Grateful Dead Announce Cornell 1977 Box Set
text:
Grateful Dead Announce Cornell 1977 Box Set One of the band’s most celebrated concert recordings is getting an official release Grateful Dead Photo by Ed Perlstein/Redferns/Getty Images 
On May 8, 1977, the Grateful Dead performed a legendary show at Cornell University’s Barton Hall in Ithaca, NY. After being traded for decades as a bootleg among fans, that concert is now getting its first official release for its 40th anniversary. The entire performance has been remastered from the original recordings and will be available in a 3xCD and 5xLP set. It will also be released as part of an 11xCD box set, May 1977: Get Shown the Light , that includes three other previously unreleased concerts from that era. All three versions are available to pre-order from the band’s website and are set for release on May 5. Listen to the Cornell 1977 version of “Morning Dew” below. 
The Grateful Dead recently announced plans to reissue their entire catalogue in honor of their 50th anniversary. The first of those reissues, 1967’s Grateful Dead , arrived last month. 
Check out the Grateful Dead’s episode of “Liner Notes” on Pitchfork.tv: Artists In This Story
